page.title: 13MEDICINAL PLANTS IN WYCHWOOD
page.content: One of the reasons that the{Nature {Conservancy Council}recommended that {WYCHWOOD FOREST }should be- come a {SITE OF SPECIAL SCIENTIFIC {INTEREST}was that many plants orig- inally used by country folk for var- ious {medicinal purposes }were grad- ually disappearing outside the boundary of the forest, but remained abundant within,where access was lim- ited. Among these plants are {DEADLY {NIGHTSHADE }and {AUTUMN CROCUS}.{Wood {Spurge}an indicator of ancient wood-land can be seen growing along the public footpaths and rides.Other abundant plants include {TRAVELLERS {JOY,COMMON VIOLET,ST.JOHN'S WORT, {SALAD BURNET,FIGWORT,SELF HEAL,WILD {BASIL & DOG'S MERCURY.}Rarer plants recorded are {ADDER'S TONGUE,GIPSY- {WORT,HAY RATTLE,FLEA-BANE,& DROPWORT.
